Kal'gerion demons are powerful Infernal demons that can be found in their resource dungeon and the Demonic Ruins. Level 90 Dungeoneering is required to damage the demons. The variants roaming in the Demonic Ruins are aggressive. They can be assigned as a Slayer task by Kuradal, Morvran, Mandrith, or Laniakea.

Kal'gerion demons are primarily killed for their Demon slayer equipment, Adrenaline urn, and Kal'gerion battle commendation drops. Obtaining and using five Kal'gerion battle commendations is a requirement for the trimmed completionist cape.

Strategy[edit | edit source]

Kal'gerion demons use long-range melee attacks, possessing moderately high life points and very high Defence for monsters of their level. Despite possessing a "Nothing" weakness icon, these demons' affinity values actually give them weaknesses. They are weak to magic attacks, moderately resistant to melee attacks and strong against ranged attacks. Magic naturally provides the best accuracy and also the most defence against their melee attacks. Nihil familiars are very helpful in providing extra accuracy against the demons due to their high defence and low affinities.

The demons in the dungeon can be easily accessed through a dungeoneering cape. In the Wilderness, it is recommended that players enter via Annakarl Teleport, as the western side is covered by a large pack of Ripper Demons and the east covered by many powerful and aggressive Greater demon berserkers and ash lords. The demons in the Wilderness are also aggressive.

Players who have completed Dimension of Disaster can also use an upgraded Darklight to make up for the lower affinity value the demons possess against melee. Since Darklight is a slash weapon, it can also benefit from the dragon scimitar's special attack, which increases its accuracy by 25% for 1 minute when used, allowing Darklight to become a very effective option for slaying Kal'gerion demons.

The demons have two possible special attacks. Each demon will only special attack once in the entire fight. In the resource dungeon, the special attacks can be avoided by hiding behind the rocks scattered throughout the dungeon, although they are very inconsistent. There are no such rocks in the Wilderness, so you will most likely take damage unless you hide behind a wall in the Demonic Ruins. The demon will charge up the special attack; in some cases, it can still be hurt while charging, and in others, be invulnerable to incoming damage during the animation. Stuns will not interrupt the special attack. Both special attacks deal hard typeless damage, though, the damage can be blocked by Barricade, or reduced by 50–100% with a defender, rebounder or repriser. The special attacks also will not trigger a Portent of restoration.

  • Drag - The demon drags its target, dealing high damage and healing itself. Players will be dealt up to 1,000 damage while the demon will heal for 5,062 life points (15% of their maximum). This attack will also bind the player without leaving a status icon indicating such. Freedom and Anticipation will not block the drag or bind, but Freedom will still clear the bind if activated afterwards. Barricade will block the damage, but will not stop the heal, drag, or bind.
  • True power - The demon jumps in the air and smashes the ground, dealing approximately 800–1,200 damage.

Special attacks will also be followed almost simultaneously by a standard melee attack from the demon. In the Rush of Blood Distraction and Diversion, the demon may attempt one of the two but will not have any effect on the player.

There is an additional attack that will also be used by the demon if the player is behind a rock or move too far away. The demons can do this at any time and more than once per fight. It is possible for this attack to override one of the main special attacks.

  • Flame portal - The demon casts a flame portal over their target's last position, dealing anywhere from 400-700 damage every few ticks. This portal will damage the player in a 3x3 radius and will disappear after a short time.

Wilderness drop table[edit | edit source]

This monster has access to the Wilderness shared loot table, which is a tertiary drop. To access the table, it has to be killed inside the Wilderness.
Luck-enhancing items are not required to access the table, but do increase the chance of doing so, as does doing higher-level content.

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • ninja 13 March 2023 (Update):
    • Kal'gerion demons in the Wilderness are now aggressive.
  • patch 24 January 2022 (Update):
    • Kal'gerion demons' special attacks now work properly inside the Sunken Pyramid.
  • patch 10 August 2020 (Update):
    • Kal'gerion demons slain inside the Shadow Reef now count towards 'Demon' cluster assignments.
  • ninja 26 November 2018 (Update):
    • Kal'gerion demons can now be damaged while charging their special move.
  • patch 24 April 2017 (Update):
    • Kal'gerion demon special attacks will now trigger inside the Wilderness.
  • patch 15 June 2015 (Update):
    • Kal'gerion demons will no longer drag players into rocks.
  • ninja 23 June 2014 (Update):
    • Due to feedback on release, the trimmed completionist cape requirement on the Kal'gerion titles has been increased from one to all five titles.
  • update 27 May 2014 (Update):
    • Added to game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Although their long-distance attack has a magic animation, it is classified as a melee attack. BTS 105 has also said that they use magic, but they do not.
  • If the player asks a slayer master on advice on how to fight Kal'gerion demons, they will tell them that they are weak to stabbing attacks, despite having a higher affinity to both darklight (a slash weapon) and magic.
  • As of 1 February 2018, the highest kill count for this monster was 45,514 kills.[1]
    • This had not increased by 6 May 2018.[2]
  • When Kal'gerion demons were released in the Wilderness, they originally appeared in all five models, though as of now they are only present in the Warmonger variant.
